bibl.title: Ling Quan et al. v. Territory of Washington. Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Puget Sound Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: King County Government, Judicial Administration. Territorial District Court Case Files, 1867-1889

div1.p: In the District Court of the 3d Judicial District holding terms at Seattle King County, Wash. Ty.
In the matter of the application of Ling Quan, Lue Tue and Lee Lung for a writ of Habeas Corpus.

On reading and filing the petition of Ah Quan for and on behalf of Ling Quan, Lue Tue and Lee Lung, duly signed and verified by him whereby it appears that they are illegally imprisoned and restrained of his liberty by Quincy A. Brooks collector of customs at Port Townsend, Wash. Tery. at the said City of Port Townsend, Jefferson County, Wash Tery and wherein the illlegality consists from which it appears to me that a writ of habeas corpus ought to issue.

It is ordered that a writ of habeas corpus issue out of and under the seal of the said District Court of the 3d Judicial District of Washington Territory holding terms at Seattle, directed to the said Quincy A. Brooks, commanding
him to have the bodies of the said Ling Quan, Lue Tue and Lee Lung before me, in the Court room of the said Court, on the 15h day of May 1888, at 10 o'clock AM. of that day, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Ling Quan, Lue Tue and Lee Lung, together with the time and cause of his detention, and that he have then and there the said writ.
Dated on the 11th day of May 1888.
